member.name: T:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo
member.summary:
A class holding information about an AI traffic plane.
This class cannot be instantiated. You can only obtain instances of AIPlaneInfo from the active AITrafficServices object.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.ToString
member.summary: Gets a string containing the plane's ATCid, departure and arrival airports

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.DepartureAirportInfo
member.summary:
The FsAirport object from the AirportsDatabase which is the departure aiport for this plane.
This will only be filled in if the AirportsDatabase has been loaded.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.ArrivalAirportInfo
member.summary:
The FsAirport object from the AirportsDatabase which is the arrival aiport for this plane.
This will only be filled in if the AirportsDatabase has been loaded.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.RunwayAssignedInfo
member.summary:
The FsRunway object from the AirportsDatabase to which this plane is assigned
This will only be filled in if the AirportsDatabase has been loaded and the plane has been assigned a runway.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.GateInfo
member.summary:
The FsGate object from the AirportsDatabase to which this plane is assigned
This will only be filled in if the AirportsDatabase has been loaded and the plane has been assigned a gate.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.IsAtGate
member.summary: True if the plane is currently at its assigned Gate.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.IsOnRunway
member.summary: True if the plane is currently on its assigned Runway.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.IsOnGround
member.summary: Tells you if this plane is on the ground (true) or airborne (false)

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.TailNumber
member.summary: The tail number for this plane. Note that this is blank unless you call the GetExtendedPlaneIdentifiers() method on this plane, or you have set the tail number to update automatically using AITrafficServices.UpdateExtendedPlaneIdentifiers().

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.Airline
member.summary: The Airline for this plane. Note that this is blank unless you call the GetExtendedPlaneIdentifiers() method on this plane, or you have set the airline to update automatically using AITrafficServices.UpdateExtendedPlaneIdentifiers().

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.FlightNumber
member.summary: The flight number for this plane if one is assigned. For GA aircraft this is the same as the tail number. Note that this is blank unless you call the GetExtendedPlaneIdentifiers() method on this plane, or you have set the flight number to update automatically using AITrafficServices.UpdateExtendedPlaneIdentifiers().

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.AircraftType
member.summary: The aircraft type (manufacturer) for this plane. Note that this is blank unless you call the GetExtendedPlaneIdentifiers() method on this plane, or you have set the aircraft type to update automatically using AITrafficServices.UpdateExtendedPlaneIdentifiers().

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.AircraftModel
member.summary: The model of this plane. Note that this is blank unless you call the GetExtendedPlaneIdentifiers() method on this plane, or you have set the aircraft model to update automatically using AITrafficServices.UpdateExtendedPlaneIdentifiers().

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.AircraftTitle
member.summary: The title of this plane from the config file. Note that this is blank unless you call the GetExtendedPlaneIdentifiers() method on this plane, or you have set the aircraft title to update automatically using AITrafficServices.UpdateExtendedPlaneIdentifiers().

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.AltitudeDifferenceFeet
member.summary: The difference between this AI plane and the player in Feet. Positive values are higher than the player, negative values are lower than the player.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.AltitudeDifferenceMetres
member.summary: The difference between this AI plane and the player in Metres. Positive values are higher than the player, negative values are lower than the player.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.DistanceFeet
member.summary: The distance between this AI plane and the player in Feet. This value is always positive.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.DistanceNM
member.summary: The distance between this AI plane and the player in Nautical Miles. This value is always positive.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.DistanceMetres
member.summary: The distance between this AI plane and the player in Metres. This value is always positive.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.BearingToMagnetic
member.summary: The bearing to this AI plane from the player in degrees magnetic.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.BearingTo
member.summary: The bearing to this AI plane from the player in degrees TRUE.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.BearingFrom
member.summary: The bearing from this AI plane to the player in degrees TRUE.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.BearingFromMag
member.summary: The bearing from this AI plane to the player in degrees MAGNETIC.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.ID
member.summary: The ID as specified in the TCAS table in FSUIPC. Negative values are FS AI aircraft. Positive values are third-party injected aircraft. Possibly.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.Location
member.summary: The location of this plane

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.AltitudeFeet
member.summary: The altitude of this plane in Feet

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.AltitudeMetres
member.summary: The altitude of this plane in Metres

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.Heading
member.summary: The TRUE heading of this plane (Not magnetic heading). Usual FSUIPC format: 360 degrees == 65536

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.HeadingDegrees
member.summary: The heading of this plane in degrees TRUE.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.HeadingDegreesMag
member.summary: The heading of this plane in degrees MAGNETIC.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.GroundSpeed
member.summary: The ground speed of this plane in Knots.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.VirticalSpeedFeet
member.summary: The virtical speed of this plane in Feet per Minute

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.VirticalSpeedMetres
member.summary: The virtical speed of this plane in Metres per Minute

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.ATCIdentifier
member.summary:
ATC identifer for this plane. By default this is Airline + Flight Number or Tail number.
For Tail number, if more than 14 chars you get the *LAST* 14. Airline name is truncated to allow whole flight number to be included
This can be changed by an option in the FSUIPC.ini file. See the FSUIPC programmers guide for details.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.State
member.summary: The current state of this plane (e.g. taking off, en route etc)

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.Com1
member.summary:
The current Com 1 frequency tuned in this plane. This is in the traditional raw FSUIPC BCD format (0Xaabb as in 1aa.bb)
NOTE that since FSUIPC 3.60, in FS2004 this is set to 0x9999 whilst the aircraft is in SLEW mode rather than normal flight mode.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.Com1String
member.summary:
A string representing the current Com 1 frequency tuned in this plane.
NOTE that since FSUIPC 3.60, in FS2004 this is set to 0x9999 whilst the aircraft is in SLEW mode rather than normal flight mode.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.Key
member.summary:
This is the flight identifier Key (usually negative, as in 0xFFFFxxxx) which can be used to identify the flight in the Traffic file. It is not guaranteed to be unique except in one traffic File.
[Note: this is not available in FSX!]

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.File
member.summary:
This is a file Id, to distinguish between multiple traffic files. The default FS2004 Traffic File has an Id of 14.
[Note: this is not available in FSX!]

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.PitchDegrees
member.summary: The pitch of the plane in degrees

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.Pitch
member.summary: The pitch of the plane in raw FSUIPC units (degrees * 65536 / 360)

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.BankDegrees
member.summary: The bank of the plane in degrees

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.Bank
member.summary: The bank of the plane in raw FSUIPC units (degrees * 65536 / 360)

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.DepartureICAO
member.summary: ICAO code of the departure airport of this plane

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.ArrivalICAO
member.summary: ICAO code of the destination airport of the plane

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.RunwayAssigned
member.summary: The assigned runway for this plane. Number will be 0 if not assigned for take-off or landing.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.GateName
member.summary:
FSX ONLY! This is a numeric representation of the gate name, when one is assigned. Otherwise it is zero.
See offset D040 in the FSUIPC4 Offsets Status PDF (in the FSUIPC SDK) for what the values mean.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.GateNumber
member.summary: FSX ONLY! This is the gate number, if it is actually numbered.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.GateType
member.summary:
FSX ONLY! This is a numeric representation of the gate type, when one is assigned. Otherwise it is zero.
See offset D040 in the FSUIPC4 Offsets Status PDF (in the FSUIPC SDK) for what the values mean.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.AIPlaneInfo.GetExtendedPlaneIndentifiers(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Immediately updates the specified extended plane identifier properties for this plane. This does not wait for the next refresh of the AI traffic.
member.param: Set to true to update the TailNumber property of this plane
Set to true to update the Airline and FlightNumber properties of this plane
Set to true to update the AircraftType and AircraftModel properties of this plane
Set to true to update the AircraftTitle property of this plane

member.name: T:FSUIPC.AirportsDatabase
member.summary: A class that reads the files produced by Pete Downson's MakeRunways.exe and provides your application with a database of airports with runway, helipad and gate information

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AirportsDatabase.Airports
member.summary: A strongly-types list of FsAirport objects. This list can be queried with LINQ.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AirportsDatabase.IsLoaded
member.summary: True if the database has been loaded.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.AirportsDatabase.Clear
member.summary: Clears all the airports from the database. Use to free up memory if your application no longer needs the database.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.AirportsDatabase.Load
member.summary: Loads the database by reading the output file from MakeRunways.exe. Looks in the main FlightSim install folder. This is provided by FSUIPC.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.AirportsDatabase.Load(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.String})
member.summary: Loads the database by reading the output file from MakeRunways.exe. Looks in the main FlightSim install folder. This is provided by FSUIPC.
member.param: A Hashset of strings containing a list of ICAO codes. Only these airports are loaded into the database.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.AirportsDatabase.Load(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the database by reading the output file from MakeRunways.exe. Looks in the folder provided in the parameter.
member.param: The full path of the folder where the MakeRunways output files can be found.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.AirportsDatabase.Load(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.String})
member.summary: Loads the database by reading the output file from MakeRunways.exe. Looks in the folder provided in the parameter.
member.param: The full path of the folder where the MakeRunways output files can be found.
A Hashset of strings containing a list of ICAO codes. Only these airports are loaded into the database.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.FsLatLonPoint.IntersectDMEMetres(System.Double,FSUIPC.FsLatLonPoint,System.Double)
member.summary:
Creates a new point by moving from the current point along a specified bearing to where the new point is a certain distance from a second point.
A typical use would be to identify the point along a given bearing where you would be a given distance from a DME/VOR marker specified as the second point.
member.param: The bearing from this point on which the intersection must occur in degrees TRUE.
The point from which the distance for the intersection is measured.
The distance required from the specified point in Metres.
member.returns: An FsLatLonPoint representing the requested intersection. If the bearing never intersects, the resulting FsLatLonPoint will be null.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.FsLatLonPoint.IntersectDMENauticalMiles(System.Double,FSUIPC.FsLatLonPoint,System.Double)
member.summary:
Creates a new point by moving from the current point along a specified bearing to where the new point is a certain distance from a second point.
A typical use would be to identify the point along a given bearing where you would be a given distance from a DME/VOR marker specified as the second point.
member.param: The bearing from this point on which the intersection must occur in degrees TRUE.
The point from which the distance for the intersection is measured.
The distance required from the specified point in Nautical Miles.
member.returns: An FsLatLonPoint representing the requested intersection. If the bearing never intersects, the resulting FsLatLonPoint will be null.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.FsLatLonPoint.IntersectDMEFeet(System.Double,FSUIPC.FsLatLonPoint,System.Double)
member.summary:
Creates a new point by moving from the current point along a specified bearing to where the new point is a certain distance from a second point.
A typical use would be to identify the point along a given bearing where you would be a given distance from a DME/VOR marker specified as the second point.
member.param: The bearing from this point on which the intersection must occur in degrees TRUE.
The point from which the distance for the intersection is measured.
The distance required from the specified point in Feet.
member.returns: An FsLatLonPoint representing the requested intersection. If the bearing never intersects, the resulting FsLatLonPoint will be null.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.FsLatLonPoint.IntersectRadial(System.Double,FSUIPC.FsLatLonPoint,System.Double)
member.summary:
Creates a new point by moving from the current point along a specified bearing to where the new point intersects a specfied raidal from a second specified point.
A typical use would be to identify the point along a given bearing where you would intercept a given radial from a VOR marker specified as the second point.
member.param: The bearing from this point on which the intersection must occur in degrees TRUE.
The point from which the radial for the intersection is measured.
The intersect radial required from the specified point in Degrees TRUE.
member.returns: An FsLatLonPoint representing the requested intersection. If the bearing never intersects, OR the intersection is more than 200NM from the specified Point, the resulting FsLatLonPoint will be null.

member.name: T:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError
member.summary: The 'traditional' error codes returned by the C version of the FSUIPC Client SDK. These error codes usually get returned in a variable called 'dwResult'. In this library, these error codes are returned in a .NET exception called FSUIPCClientException.

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_OK
member.summary: No error.

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_OPEN
member.summary: Attempt to Open() when connection is already open.

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_NOFS
member.summary: Cannot link to FSUIPC or WideClient

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_REGMSG
member.summary: Failed to Register common message with Windows

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_ATOM
member.summary: Failed to create Atom for mapping filename

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_MAP
member.summary: Failed to create a file mapping object

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_VIEW
member.summary: Failed to open a view to the file map

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_VERSION
member.summary: Incorrect version of FSUIPC, or not FSUIPC.

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_WRONGFS
member.summary: Flight Sim is not version requested by this application.

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_NOTOPEN
member.summary: Attempted to call Process() but the FSUIPC link has not been opened.

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_NODATA
member.summary: Call cannot execute: no requests accumulated

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_TIMEOUT
member.summary: IPC SendMessage timed out (all retries)

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_SENDMSG
member.summary: IPC SendMessage failed (all retries)

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_DATA
member.summary: IPC request contains bad data

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_RUNNING
member.summary: Wrong version of FSUIPC. Can also occur if running on WideClient but FSUIPC is not running on server.

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_SIZE
member.summary: Read or Write request cannot be added to the shared memory file as the file is full.

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_ERR_WRITE_OVERFLOW
member.summary: Tried to write a string or byte array that was longer than the declared length of this Offset.

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_KEY_SLOTS_FULL
member.summary: All user input key slots were full.

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_BUTTON_SLOTS_FULL
member.summary: All user input joystick button slots were full.

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_PARENT_MENU_NOT_FOUND
member.summary: The Parent menu specified cannot be found

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_TYPE_NOT_SUPPORTED
member.summary: The data type cannot be used for offset values

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FSUIPCError.FSUIPC_WRITE_OFFSET_NEVER_READ
member.summary:
An attempt was made to write a value to an offset that has never been read. Offsets must be read at least once so thier values are in sync with the Flight Sim.
If this offset is only for writing to, mark it as WriteOnly when declaring it.

member.name: T:FSUIPC.AITrafficServices
member.summary:
A class that provides information about the AI aircraft in Flight Simulator. This reads the TCAS tables from FSUIPC and presents the information in a .NET friendly collection of AIPlaneInfo classes.
This class cannot be instantiated, you must obtain a reference to the active instance via the property on the FSUIPCConnection class.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AITrafficServices.GroundTraffic
member.summary: A .NET List of AIPlaneInfo objects representing AI traffic on the ground in order of distance from the player. The closest AI plane is the first in the list.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AITrafficServices.AirborneTraffic
member.summary: A .NET List of AIPlaneInfo objects representing AI traffic in the air in order of distance from the player. The closest AI plane is the first in the list.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.AITrafficServices.AllTraffic
member.summary: A .NET List of AIPlaneInfo objects representing all AI traffic in order of distance from the player. The closest AI plane is the first in the list.

member.summary: Retrieves a specific AIPlaneInfo object with the specified ID.
member.param: The ID of the plane to bring back
member.returns: The requested AIPlaneInfo or null (Nothing in VB) is the ID was not found.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.AITrafficServices.UpdateExtendedPlaneIndentifiers(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Tells the AITrafficServices to retrieve the specified extended plane identifier properties for all planes when updating the AI Traffic Information.

Getting this data from FSUIPC is very inefficient. Setting these option could cause long delays when calling RefreshAITrafficInformation() for the first time (possibly over 1 second per plane over WideFS)
However, subsequent calls will be very fast as this information is only ever retrieved once per plane. Only new AI traffic entering the system will cause a very slight delay.
The more extended information you request the longer any delays will be.
See also: AITrafficServices.OverrideAirborneTrafficINISettings() and OverrideGroundTrafficINISettings()

member.param: Set to true to update the TailNumber property for all planes
Set to true to update the Airline and FlightNumber properties for all planes
Set to true to update the AircraftType and AircraftModel properties for all planes
Set to true to update the AircraftTitle property for all planes

member.summary: Refreshes the information for ground and air AI traffic as specified
member.param: Set to true to update the information for traffic on the ground
Set to true to update the information for traffic in the air

member.name: M:FSUIPC.AITrafficServices.ApplyFilter(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double,System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Applies a filter to the ground and/or airborne traffic lists. All traffic falling outside of the specified critia is deleted from the traffic lists.
member.param: Apply the filter to the gound traffic list
Apply the filter to the airborne traffic list

Specifies the start of a bearing arc. Only AI Traffic within this bearing arc in relation to the player is kept. This is TRUE bearing in degrees.
For no bearing restriction set this to 0 and the EndBearing to 360

Specifies the end of a bearing arc. Only AI Traffic within this bearing arc in relation to the player is kept. This is TRUE bearing in degrees.
For no bearing restriction set this to 360 and the StartBearing to 0
Only AI Traffic above this altitude is kept. This is in Feet. Set to null (Nothing in VB) for no minimum limit.
Only AI Traffic below this altitude is kept. This is in Feet. Set to null (Nothing in VB) for no maximum limit.
Only AI Traffic within this distance is kept. This is in Nautical Miles. Set to null (Nothing in VB) for no distance limit.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.AITrafficServices.GetArrivalRunwaysInUse(System.String)

summary.para: Gets a list of the runways in use for arriving aircraft for the given airport code.

Note that this information is derived from the AI traffic information and is therefore only as current as the last RefreshAITrfficInformation() call. Airports will only show active runways if they have AI planes currently assigned to a runway . This information is not harmed by filtering the AI traffic.
Note also that this is NOT using the FSUIPC facilities at D000. FSUIPC takes ages to give this information back whereas this DLL can return it instantly.

member.param: The ICAO code for the airport you want active arrival runways for.
member.returns: A List of FSRunway objects representing the runways in use.

member.returns: A dictionary of Lists of FSRunway objects representing the runways in use. The key is the ICAO code of the airport.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.AITrafficServices.OverrideAirborneTrafficINISettings(System.Nullable{FSUIPC.ATCIdentifier},System.Nullable{System.Byte})

summary.para: This method allows you to override the setting in the user's FSUIPC.INI file.

Note that because of the internal workings of FSUIPC, your override will be cancelled after 20 seconds. Therefore you need to call this method on a regular basis. The FSUIPC documentation recommends every 5 seconds.

member.param: The format you want for the ATCIdentifier property. Set to null (Nothing in VB) to use the setting in the FSUIPC.INI file. This ATCIdentifier is only 15 characters long. If the info you request won't fit it will be truncated. Consider using the extended plane identifiers feature instead to get this information. See AITrafficTools.UpdateExtendedPlaneIdentifiers()
The range around the player's aircraft in which AI traffic will be detected. In Nautical Miles. 0=Unlimited. Null (Nothing in VB)=Use setting in FSUIPC.INI file.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.AITrafficServices.OverrideGroundTrafficINISettings(System.Nullable{FSUIPC.ATCIdentifier},System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Byte},System.Nullable{System.Byte})

summary.para: This method allows you to override the setting in the user's FSUIPC.INI file.

Note that because of the internal workings of FSUIPC, your override will be cancelled after 20 seconds. Therefore you need to call this method on a regular basis. The FSUIPC documentation recommends every 5 seconds.

member.param: The format you want for the ATCIdentifier property. This ATCIdentifier is only 15 characters long. If the info you request won't fit it will be truncated. Consider using the extended plane identifiers feature instead to get this information. See AITrafficTools.UpdateExtendedPlaneIdentifiers()
Set to True to prioritise active aircraft (not sleeping or initialising) when the FSUIPC Traffic Tables get full. Set to False to prioritise closest aircraft regardless of state.
The range around the player's aircraft in which ground AI traffic will be detected while the Player is in the AIR. In Nautical Miles. 0=Unlimited. Null (Nothing in VB)=Use setting in FSUIPC.INI file.

The range around the player's aircraft in which ground AI traffic will be detected while the player is on the GROUND. In Nautical Miles. 0=Unlimited. Null (Nothing in VB)=Use setting in FSUIPC.INI file.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.AITrafficServices.AddTCASTarget(System.Int32,System.String,FSUIPC.AITrafficStatus,FSUIPC.FsLatitude,FSUIPC.FsLongitude,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int16,System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary: Adds a TCAS Target to the internal FSUIPC AI Traffic Tables. This does not add AI planes to Flight Sim. Add as many targets as you like and send them to FSUIPC with SendTCASTargets(). To erase an aircraft provide the specific id for that entry, and set the ATCIdentifier parameter to a zero-length string. In any case, FSUIPC will automatically erase any externally supplied aircraft after about 812 seconds if it receives no further updates in that time. Even if the aircraft is static you'll need to supply updates for it regularly. For FSX this feature REQUIRES FSUIPC4 version 4.536 or above.
member.param: Your own ID
The ATC Identifier string (e.g. flight no or call sign etc...). Set to a zero-length string to erase the TCAS target from FSUIPC.
The state of the plane
The Latitude of the plane
The Longitude of the plane
The Altitude of the plane in Feet
The True heading (not magnetic) of the plane in degrees.
The ground speed of the plane in knots
The virtical speed of the plane in Feet per Second
COM1 frequency, 4 digits in BCD format. A frequency of 123.45 is represented by 0x2345. The leading 1 is assumed

member.name: M:FSUIPC.AITrafficServices.SendTCASTargets
member.summary: Sends the TCAS targets added with AddTCASTarget() to FSUIPC. For FSX this feature REQUIRES FSUIPC4 version 4.536 or above.

member.name: T:FSUIPC.FSUIPCConnection
member.summary: A class that handles communication and data transfer to and from Pete Dowson's FSUIPC or WideFS.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.FSUIPCConnection.GroupsIsolatedToThread
member.summary:
Sets/Gets whether or not groups are unique to threads or can be accessed via any thread.
If set to false a group created on one thread can be processed/deleted on a different thread.
If true, groups are isolated to the thread on which they were created. Groups created on one thread cannot be processed/deleted from another. Groups created on different threads can have the same name.

In order for this to work the Flight Sim window will become the active window.
If you want focus to return to your application, pass a reference to the form to return to.
member.param: The key to send. No not use modifiers here, use the parameter provided.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.FSUIPCConnection.MoveAircraft(FSUIPC.FsGate,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Moves the player aircraft to a Gate from the Airports Database.
Only works with FSX and above
member.param: The FsGate object representing the gate to move the player aircraft to
If set to true, the sim will be paused after moving the aircraft

member.name: M:FSUIPC.FSUIPCConnection.MoveAircraft(FSUIPC.FsPositionSnapshot,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Moves the player aircraft according to the values in the position snapshot.
A position snapshot can be created manually, or automactially using the FSUIPConnection.GetPositionSnapshot() method.
Only works with FSX and above
member.param: The FsGate object representing the gate to move the player aircraft to
If set to true, the sim will be paused after moving the aircraft

member.name: M:FSUIPC.FSUIPCConnection.MoveAircraft(FSUIPC.FsRunway,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Moves the player aircraft to a Runway from the Airports Database.
Only works with FSX and above
member.param: The FsRunway object representing the runway to move the player aircraft to. The player will be moves to the runway's start location with the correct heading.
If set to true, the sim will be paused after moving the aircraft

member.name: M:FSUIPC.FSUIPCConnection.MoveAircraft(FSUIPC.FsHelipad,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Moves the player aircraft to a Helipad from the Airports Database.
Only works with FSX and above
member.param: The FsHelipad object representing the helipad to move the player aircraft to.
If set to true, the sim will be paused after moving the aircraft

member.name: M:FSUIPC.FSUIPCConnection.MoveAircraft(FSUIPC.FsLatLonPoint,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{FSUIPC.FsAltitude},System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Moves the player aircraft to a new lon/lat location. You may optionally specify new Altitude, Indicated Airspeed, Pitch, Bank or Heading values.
Only works with FSX and above
member.param: The new FsLatLonPoint to move to
Pass true if you want the aircraft on the ground after moving. (Speed and Altitude are ignored in this case)

The new altitude passed as a FsAltitude class. (e.g. FsAltitude.FromFeet(3000))
Pass null (Nothing in VB) to keep the current altitude)

The new heading in degrees true
Pass null (Nothing in VB) to keep the current heading)

The new pitch angle of the aircraft in degrees
Pass null (Nothing in VB) to keep the current pitch angle)

The new bank angle of the aircraft in degrees true
Pass null (Nothing in VB) to keep the current bank angle)

The new indicated airspeed of the aircraft in knots
Pass null (Nothing in VB) to keep the current airspeed)
If set to true, the sim will be paused after moving the aircraft

member.name: M:FSUIPC.FSUIPCConnection.MoveAircraft(System.Byte,FSUIPC.FsLatLonPoint,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{FSUIPC.FsAltitude},System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Moves the player aircraft to a new lon/lat location. You may optionally specify new Altitude, Indicated Airspeed, Pitch, Bank or Heading values.
Only works with FSX and above
member.param: The number of the Class Instance of WideClient you want to talk to.
The new FsLatLonPoint to move to
Pass true if you want the aircraft on the ground after moving. (Speed and Altitude are ignored in this case)

The new altitude passed as a FsAltitude class. (e.g. FsAltitude.FromFeet(3000))
Pass null (Nothing in VB) to keep the current altitude)

The new heading in degrees true
Pass null (Nothing in VB) to keep the current heading)

The new pitch angle of the aircraft in degrees
Pass null (Nothing in VB) to keep the current pitch angle)

The new bank angle of the aircraft in degrees true
Pass null (Nothing in VB) to keep the current bank angle)

The new indicated airspeed of the aircraft in knots
Pass null (Nothing in VB) to keep the current airspeed)
If set to true, the sim will be paused after moving the aircraft

member.name: M:FSUIPC.FSUIPCConnection.GetPositionSnapshot

Takes a snapshot of the current position of the aircraft including: Location, altitude, heading, pitch, bank, onGround and IAS.
Note that this information can be passed directly to the MoveAircraft method.
member.returns: A FsPositionSnapshot class holding the position values

Takes a snapshot of the current position of the aircraft including: Location, altitude, heading, pitch, bank, onGround and IAS.
Note that this information can be passed directly to the MoveAircraft method.
member.param: The number of the Class Instance of WideClient you want to talk to.
member.returns: A FsPositionSnapshot class holding the position values

member.summary: Forces this offset to be read

member.name: P:FSUIPC.Offset.Address
member.summary: The FSUIPC offset address to read from or write to, as specified in the FSUIPC for Programmer's document.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.Offset.ActionAtNextProcess
member.summary:
This property can be used to force this offset to be read or written on the next process.
Normally you need not set this as the default (AutoSense) works perfectly well.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.Offset.IsConnected
member.summary: Indicates if this Offset is currently 'Connected'. Offsets that are disconnected will not be updated or have changes written to FSUIPC when Process() is run. This is read-only. To connect or disconnect an Offset call the Connect() or Disconnect() methods.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.Offset.WriteOnly
member.summary: Indicates that this Offset is to be Write-Only. While marked as Write-Only the value of this Offset will never be read from FSUIPC. If you change the value of this Offset the new value will be written to FSUIPC on the next process.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.Offset.Disconnect
member.summary: Immediately disconnects this Offset from FSUIPC. The value of this Offset will no longer be updated or written during Process() calls. Use Reconnect() to start updating again.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.Offset.Disconnect(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disconnects this Offset from the FSUIPCConnection class. The value of this Offset will no longer be updated or written during Process() calls. Use Reconnect() to start updating again.
member.param: If true, the Offset will not be disconnected until after you call Process(). If false the Offset is disconnected immediately.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.Offset.Reconnect
member.summary: Permenently reconnects this Offset to FSUIPC. The value of this Offset will be read/written during subsequent Process() calls.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.Offset.Reconnect(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reconnects this Offset to FSUIPC. The value of this Offset will be updated/written during subsequent Process() calls.
member.param: If true, the Offset is reconnected only for the next Process() call. After that it's disconnected again. If false, the Offset is reconnected until you call Disconnect().

member.name: P:FSUIPC.Offset.IsFixedLengthString
member.summary: True is this offset represents a fixed length string.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.Offset.Connected
member.summary: Returns true is this offset is currently connected. i.e. it will be read or written during process() calls.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.Offset.Write
member.summary: True if the offset will be Written during the next process() call.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.Offset.OnceOnly
member.summary: True if this offset will be read or written only during the next process() call. After this the offset will be disconnected.

member.name: T:FSUIPC.Offset`1
member.summary: Represents an item of strongly-typed data that can be read from or written to an FSUIPC offset.
member.typeparam:
The native (.NET) type representing the data held in the FSUIPC offset.
Native .NET types supported are: Byte, SByte, Int16, UInt16, Int32, UInt32, Int64, UInt64, Double, Single, String, BitArray, FsLongitude, FsLatitude
Depending on the language you are using there may be other ways of referring to these base types.
E.g. Int16 in VB.NET is also 'Short'. In C# it's 'short'.
To read/Write raw bytes of any length from FSUIPC use an array of Bytes. (Byte() in VB.NET, byte[] in C#)

member.name: T:FSUIPC.UserInputServices
member.summary: Class to easily manage user interaction in your FSUIPC applciation. Key strokes and Button presses can be registered and then detected when the user presses these keys or buttons in the Flight Sim application. Also Menu items can be added to flight sim and you can detect when the user selects them.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.UserInputServices.AddKeyPress(System.String,FSUIPC.ModifierKeys,System.Windows.Forms.Keys,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a key press to be detected. Sink the KeyPressed event to detect then the user pressed this key.
member.param: A string that you will use to identity and detect this key press.
Any modifier keys that you want to be held when the main key is pressed. These modifers can be combined with a bitwise OR.
The key to be pressed.
If true, the keypress will also be passed to Flight Sim. If false, the keypress will not be passed on to Flight Sim.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.UserInputServices.AddJoystickButtonPress(System.String,System.Byte,System.Byte,FSUIPC.StateChange)
member.summary: Adds a joystick button press to be detected. Sink the ButtonPressed event to detect then the user pressed this button.
member.param: A string that you will use to identity and detect this button press.
The number of the Joystick (0-15) to detect.
The number of the Button to detect.
Which states to detect.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.UserInputServices.AddMenuItem(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a menu item to the Flight Sim menu. Sink the MenuSelected event to detect then the user selects this menu item.
member.param: A string that you will use to identity and detect this menu item.
The text to display in the Flight Sim menu. A short-cut letter can be marked by prefixing it with an ampersand (&).
Set to true if you want Flight Sim to pause after this menu item is selected. You will need to unpause Flight Sim in your application when ready to continue.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.UserInputServices.AddSubMenuItem(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Adds a sub-menu item to the Flight Sim menu. FSX/ESP/P3D and later ONLY.
Note that the Pause On Selection can be set on the Parent Menu only and applied to all sub menus.
Only one level of sub menus are supported.
member.param: A string that you will use to identity and detect this menu item.

The ID of the main menu item that this new menu will be place under.
This cannot be another sub menu.
The text to display in the Flight Sim menu. A short-cut letter can be marked by prefixing it with an ampersand (&).

member.name: M:FSUIPC.UserInputServices.CheckForInput
member.summary: Call this method regularly to check if the user has pressed any key or button or has selected a menu item. FSUIPC documentation recommends every 200ms.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.UserInputServices.KeepMenuItemsAlive
member.summary: Call this method to keep the menu items alive. The FSUIPC documentation recommends every 5-10 seconds. All menu items will time-out and be removed after approx. 14 seconds if this is not called.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.UserInputServices.RemoveKeyPress(System.String)
member.summary: Cancels and removes a key press
member.param: The ID of the key press to cancel/remove

member.name: M:FSUIPC.UserInputServices.RemoveJoystickButtonPress(System.String)
member.summary: Cancels and removes a joystick button press
member.param: The ID of the button press to cancel/remove

member.name: M:FSUIPC.UserInputServices.RemoveMenuItem(System.String)
member.summary: Cancels and removes a menu item
member.param: The ID of the menu item to cancel/remove

member.name: M:FSUIPC.UserInputServices.RemoveAll
member.summary: Cancels and removes all key presses, button presses and menu items. It is recommended that you call this method before your application exits.

member.summary: This event is raised when one of the registered keys is pressed.

member.summary: This event is raised when one of the registered joystick buttons is pressed.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.WeatherServices.SetWeatherChangeRate(FSUIPC.FsWeatherDynamics)
member.summary:
Changes the weather change rate option in FS. This is the slider on the weather tab in the display settings dialog.
This change is only the for the current session and is not remembered when Flight Sim is restarted.
member.param: An FsWeatherDynamics value representing the new change rate setting.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.WeatherServices.EnableGlobalWeather
member.summary:
Required for FSX+ Only. Puts FS into Global Weather Mode. You should only set Global weather after enabling this feature.
Note that the DLL will call this automatically when you set any global weather for the first time.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.WeatherServices.SetGlobalWeather(FSUIPC.FsWeather)
member.summary: Set the global weather to the weather described in the FsWeather object passed in.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.WeatherServices.SetGlobalWeather(FSUIPC.FsWeather,System.Boolean,System.UInt16)
member.summary:
Set the global weather to the weather described in the FsWeather object passed in.
NOTE: For FSX+ you must enable the global weather mode by calling EnableGlobalWeather()
member.param: An FsWeather object containing the weather to be set.
Set to true if you want to bypass the weather options set the user in FSUIPC.
FSX+ ONLY. A value in seconds to make this weather active after a delay, gradually "blending" into the existing weather.

An FsWeather object containing the weather to be set.

member.summary:
When reading weather from a weather station this is the elevation of that station in Metres.
For weather at the aircraft location this is the elevation of the ground beneath the aircraft.
For weather at a specific Lat/Lon location this is always 0.

member.name: P:FSUIPC.FsWeather.ElevationFeet
member.summary:
When reading weather from a weather station this is the elevation of that station in Feet.
For weather at the aircraft location this is the elevation of the ground beneath the aircraft.
For weather at a specific Lat/Lon location this is always 0.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.FsWeather.ToXML
member.summary:
Converts this FsWeather instance into an XML string.
This can be used by your application to save weather settings for future use. To create an FsWeather object from XML use FsWeather.FromXML()
See also Save() and FsWeather.Load()
member.returns: An XML string representing the setting for this weather object.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.FsWeather.FromXML(System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a new instance of FsWeather from an XML string.
To generate the XML for an instance of FsWeather, use the ToXML() method on the object instance.
See also Save() and FsWeather.Load()

member.name: M:FSUIPC.FsWeather.Save(System.String)
member.summary:
Saves the current weather settings to an XML file on the disk.
Use FsWeather.Load() to load the saved data.
See also ToXML() and FsWeather.FromXML()
member.param: The full name and path of the file to save to.

member.name: M:FSUIPC.FsWeather.Load(System.String)
member.summary:
Loads the weather settings from an XML file on the disk and creates a new instance of FsWeather.
Use the Save() method on the FsWeather object to save the data to a file on the disk.
See also ToXML() and FsWeather.FromXML()
member.param: The full name and path of the file to load from.

member.name: F:FSUIPC.FsWeatherFlags.BlendToNewWeather
member.summary:
Set this flag if "BlendTimeInSeconds" value is to be used in setting weather in FSX This applies to weather set via NWI values or via the NEXT Metar string written to B000. It's a "one shot" flag, cleared after use.
The Seconds value determines whether the weather change is effective immediately or after a delay, gradually "blending" into the existing weather.
